resources.string: You can use this app to check your visitors\' coronavirus passes. This way your location can stay open safely.
Visitors first make a QR code of their certificate. With this app, you can check the QR codes and see who is allowed to enter.
Always ask visitors to show their proof of identity. Check whether the details on your screen match the details on their ID document. All good? Then the visitor is allowed to enter.
With this app, you can receive visitors again. But only if your location or activity falls under the designated locations.
The acceptable use policy details how CoronaCheck Scanner uses your data and what your rights are.
Location data are not saved or used
You\'re only allowed to use this data to check the certificate
The visitor\'s data is not centrally stored anywhere
I\'ve read and agree to the acceptable use policy.
Sorry, there was a technical error
Scan your visitors\' QR codes. Is the QR code valid and are the details the same as on the proof of identity? Then you can give the visitor access.
This is an international QR code
This is not a valid certificate in the Netherlands. Ask the visitor to show a Dutch QR code.

The visitor doesn\'t have a valid coronavirus pass.
Read possible causes

A red screen with a cross means the QR code does not comply with the Dutch regulations.

Here\'s what you can do:
  1. Check if the time is set correctly, on the visitor\'s phone as well as your own. Make sure date and time are set to \'set automatically\'.
  2. Check if the visitor is showing an original certificate. A screenshot of their certificate may cause problems.
  3. Ask the visitor to completely close the app, and restart it. Please rescan the QR code after.

Does the screen stay red?
Ask the visitor to contact the CoronaCheck help desk.

Please note: without a green screen with check mark, the visitor cannot be given access.
This QR code does not contain a coronavirus pass
Ask the visitor to show a QR code of a coronavirus pass.
Ask for a Dutch QR code
You have scanned an international QR code. In the Netherlands, CoronaCheck users should show their Dutch QR code.

You cannot grant the visitor access if the details on your screen are different from those on the identity document.

Please note: sometimes not all details are shown
This is done to protect the visitor\'s privacy. You will see a hyphen (-) in the field. In this case, verify only the details you\'re seeing.

CoronaCheck Scanner is created to help certain places and activities safely open their doors.

Visitors can create a coronavirus pass with a QR code of their vaccination, negative test result, or recovery from coronavirus. Using this app, only visitors with a coronavirus pass are given access. This way, more and more places can be visited safely.
Use your phone\'s camera to scan visitors\' QR codes, in the CoronaCheck app or on paper. Tourists can show their QR code in a foreign app or on paper.
For visitors aged 14 and over, always check if the details on your screen are the same as on the visitor\'s proof of identity. This way, you can ensure the QR code belongs to the visitor.
Sometimes not all details are shown
Sometimes not all details are shown
Details can be left out to protect the visitor\'s privacy. You will see a hyphen (-) instead. In this case, only check the details that are visible.
Person is holding a phone with a red screen and a black cross.
Does your screen turn green and show a check mark? In that case, the QR code is valid and the details are the same as on the proof of identity. You can grant the visitor access.
Scanner wants to access your camera
So the app can scan QR codes
Prefer laser scanning?\n\nUse the yellow buttons on your device.
The app is not in use at the moment. For more information, go to CoronaCheck.nl
To continue, install the latest version of the app.
You\'re not connected to the internet
You need to be connected to start the app.
There\'s a new version of the app available.

Here\'s what changed

  • Description of acceptable use policy
  • App usage explanation
  • Camera usage permission
Read the full acceptable use policy here.
You can\'t proceed if you don\'t agree
You don\'t have access to the CoronaCheck Scanner app if you don\'t agree to the updated policy.
What should I pay attention to?
Please note: ID check is mandatory
Check your phone\'s time settings. They might be incorrect.

In order to properly use the CoronaCheck Scanner app, it is important that the time on your phone is set correctly. For example, if the clock on your phone is a few minutes ahead, an error might occur while verifying a coronavirus pass.

Go to your phone\'s settings and set Date & Time to \'set automatically\'.
Does your screen turn red and show a cross? In that case, you\'ll receive information to assist the visitor. If the screen stays red, you cannot grant the visitor access.
App in use for longer than one month
You can give access to visitors with a test, vaccination or recovery certificate.
You can only give access to visitors with a test certificate.
Which kind of access can I give?
For your location, please specify if you\'re going to give 1G or 3G access. Check which kind of access you can give before you start scanning.
With 1G access, only visitors with a test certificate are allowed to enter. With 3G access, visitors with a test, vaccination or recovery certificate are allowed to enter.

The scan setting log keeps track of the type of access used during scanning. A civil enforcement officer may request access to this log.

For privacy reasons, only scan settings used in the last %d minutes are saved on this phone. No personal information is saved. You can read more about this in the frequently asked questions.
For your location, please specify if you\'re going to give 1G or 3G access. Check which kind of access you can give before you start scanning.
Which kind of access can I give?
You have to wait for %d minutes because you changed your scan settings while scanning.
Kies een instelling waarin je wilt scannen.

Choose your scan setting.

Please note: if you change scan settings while scanning, you have to wait for %d minutes before you can scan again.
Are you sure you want to change the setting?
If you change scan settings, you have to wait for %d minutes before you can scan again.
Clearing will delete all data and certificates from the app and will close the app. You can simply restart it afterwards.
Scan your visitors\' QR codes. Is the QR code valid for your location, and are the details the same as on the proof of identity? Then you can give the visitor access.
Does your screen show a check mark? In that case, the QR code is valid and the details are the same as on the proof of identity. You can grant the visitor access.

A red screen with a cross means the QR code does not comply with the Dutch regulations, or is not valid for your location.

Here\'s what you can do:
  1. Let the visitor know what type of access your location can give. Please note: 1G access only allows visitors with a test certificate to enter.
  2. Check if the time is set correctly, on the visitor\'s phone as well as your own. Make sure date and time are set to \'set automatically\'.
  3. Check if the visitor is showing an original certificate. A screenshot of their certificate may cause problems.
  4. Ask the visitor to completely close the app, and restart it. Please rescan the QR code after.

Does the screen stay red?
Ask the visitor to contact the CoronaCheck help desk.

Please note: without a screen with check mark, the visitor cannot be given access.
Prefer the barcode scanner?\nUse the scan buttons on your device.

Only visitors with a test certificate get access at places where the coronavirus entry pass is being used (1G access). The CoronaCheck scanner only shows a screen with a check mark when scanning a test certificate.
You cannot grant the visitor access if the details on your screen are different from those on the identity document.

Please note: sometimes not all details are shown
This is done to protect the visitor\'s privacy. You will see a hyphen (-) in the field. In this case, verify only the details you\'re seeing.
When you contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk, you may be asked for the following information:

If you have any questions or experience problems, you can contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk.

Call the helpdesk:
%2$s (free). Or, if you are calling from abroad: %4$s.

Open from %5$s till %6$s, between %7$s - %8$s

Or send an email to:
helpdesk@coronacheck.nl

If you have any questions or experience problems, you can contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk.

Call the helpdesk:
%2$s (free).
Or, if you are calling from abroad: %2$s.

Open from %1$s till %2$s, between %3$s - %4$s

Or send an email to:
helpdesk@coronacheck.nl
